trial_identification.studytitle: Does exercise enhance mucociliary clearance in adults with cystic fibrosis?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Exercise for mucus clearance in cystic fibrosis

interventions.interventions: Treadmill exercise, speed and incline set to achieve an exercise intensity of 60% of each subject's peak VO2 for 20 minutes on one occasion. Peak VO2 measured on the day prior to randomisation. Positive expiratory pressure (PEP). Subjects breath through a PEP device which provides an expiratory pressure at the mouth of 15-20cmH2O. Subjects breath through this device for 15 breaths, followed by the Forced Expiratory Techinique. This cycle is repeated six times in a 20 minute period on one occasion. Control (resting breathing). Sitting quietly, relaxed breathing for 20 minutes on one occasion.
interventions.comparator: Positive expiratory pressure (PEP). Subjects breath through a PEP device which provides an expiratory pressure at the mouth of 15-20cmH2O. Subjects breath through this device for 15 breaths, followed by the Forced Expiratory Techinique. This cycle is repeated six times in a 20 minute period on one occasion. Control (resting breathing). Sitting quietly, relaxed breathing for 20 minutes on one occasion.

primaryOutcome.outcome: mucociliary clearance, measured by inhaled radioaerosol
primaryOutcome.timepoint: pre-intervention, immediately post intervention, 1 hour post intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: subjective feeling of lung congestion, measured on a 10cm visual analogue scale
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: pre-intervention, immediately post intervention, 1 hour post intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: subjective ease of expectoration, measured on a 10cm visual analogue scale
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: pre-intervention, during intervention, 1 hour post intervention

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: diagnosed with cystic fibrosis, stable clinical condition
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: previous lung transplant, pregnant, if participation resulted in the 5 year radiation does for volunteers being exceeded

trial_design.sequence: random number generation, using a computer program

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Research Office A14 Main Quadrangle University of Sydney 2006

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Research Office A14 Main Quadrangle University of Sydney 2006

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The trial completed recruitment and data collection in 2011. Results presented at the European Cystic Fibrosis Conference and the Australasian Cystic Fibrosis Conference in 2011. Manuscript under preparation.
ethicsAndSummary.publication:
Dwyer T, Daviskas E, Zainuldin M, Verschuer J, Eberl S, Bye P, Mellis C, Alison J. "Effects of exercise and PEP on mucociliary clearance in adults with cystic fibrosis". 9th Australasian Cystic Fibrosis Conference, Melbourne, Australia. 2011:p15-16.
Dwyer T. Exercise for airway clearance. 34th European Cystic Fibrosis Conference, Hamburg, Germany. 2011 (invited speaker, no abstract).
